body:
What do you mean - a PR with the tests, or a PR with the fix?

I'm not sure I know how to fix this...
A PR with the fix. It seems that all you want is a better error message. That should be easy enough, you already know the location to check.

I would prefer if no error was thrown at all, but if it led to invalid mappings it was discovered upon mapping validation. I'll take a stab at it, but unless it turns out to be really easy (so easy I can manage it while waiting for builds at work today) I'm afraid it's not going to happen until August at the earliest.

issue.title: Make constructor mapping a little more lenient
issue.body:
Before, all attempts at mapping constructor parameters for classes that
did not have a constructor defined, or where no defined constructor had
a parameter with that name, would throw an exception with a pretty poor
uninformative exception message.

These scenarios are now considered valid mapping configurations, as long
as the stuff that's needed to actually perform a mapping is also
configured.

Fixes #1528

body: Turns out it wasn't so hard after all :)
From the other one, this should throw an AutoMapperConfigurationException. I can't build up the configuration if it's misconfigured, but InvalidOperation is noooooot the right one to do.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
